name: Roadkill II
description: Origami folded watercolour prints of victims of the modern world (Squirrel, Frog, Pigeon) become gentle reminders of mortality and our own vulnerability. Books in memorandum - A series of 3 creatures, each inkjet printed on Somerset enhanced paper from original watercolours, with hand tinting, hard greyboard covers with silver/copper/gold heat foil blocked title. 9x 9cm, 3rd Edition of 10, 2013.

name: письма-‐треугольники - Letters of triangles
description:
письма-‐треугольники - Letters of triangles 

There was a time in which soldiers, having a prolonged absence from home, were thought to suffer and sometimes die of Nostalgia. This malaise later became known as homesickness. During WWII Russian soldiers sent triangular correspondence to their loved ones. In these письма-треугольники, the letter and envelope were one, allowing censors to access and omit any sensitive material without compromising the structure. The simple design meant the content and address never became separated and made the letters easily identifiable as priority mail to the postal service. 

Letterpress printed edition of 40, of which the first 10 letters are housed in a handmade clamshell box with handkerchief printed linings and special edition triangular letter. Non-boxed edition printed with Copper and Gold ink on found paper and tracing paper, housed inside a triangular envelope. Published by Battenburg Press in April of 2013.

name: письма-‐треугольники - Letters of triangles Boxed Work
description:
There was a time in which soldiers, having a prolonged absence from home, were thought to suffer and sometimes die of Nostalgia. This malaise later became known as homesickness. During WWII Russian soldiers sent triangular correspondence to their loved ones. In these письма-треугольники, the letter and envelope were one, allowing censors to access and omit any sensitive material without compromising the structure. The simple design meant the content and address never became separated and made the letters easily identifiable as priority mail to the postal service.

Letterpress printed edition of 10. Letters are housed in a handmade clamshell box with mascara stained handkerchief inkjet printed linings and special edition triangular letter. Edition printed with Copper and Gold ink on found paper and tracing paper, special edition letter printed on Rives Arches on a Heidleburg Platten Press. Published by Battenburg Press, Manchester in April of 2013.

name: New York I Love You, but you're bringing me down.
description:
New York I Love You, but you're bringing me down.
A recent book edition created as an ode to the Big Apple and my three months spent there in the winter of 2011. A photographic and text response to the patterns of life in an unrelenting city. A struggle/survive, embrace/despise, resist/collide tone resonating from beginning to end. A love letter to the man, rather than Manhattan.

One colour digitally printed, perfect bound with hand made cover in Atlantic Mist book cloth, heat foil debossed with silver Empire State. Edition of 10, 2013.

name: Souvenirs of Vulnerability
description:
A collection of object portraits of souvenirs that marked moments of vulnerability in relationships. Each page is a Riso-print translation of the original watercolour paintings. The pages are french folded, perforated and sewn with a variation on a Japanese Stab binding. Each page must be separated by the viewer in order to expose the artwork souvenir. Each book is housed in a bespoke slip case, covered in teal blue or candy pink bookcloth, foil debossed with a yellow banana. 

Two colour Risograph printed in soya based ink (Gold & Orange/Flouoro Pink) on Zerkall 145gsm paper, soft-back cover Riso-printed on handmade paper with reduced stab stitch in silk embroidery thread, Edition of 8, teal or pink slip cases available 130 x 190 mm, 2013.
For further images go here:
http://www.paper-gallery.co.uk/70879/706169/paper-artists/lucy-may-schofield
